page.title: 06SHOPS THEN AND NOW.
page.content: There used to be a large number of shops in the village.There was a cobber's shop,two bakers,a post office which sold sweets,a saddler's shop, a butcher's shop and a watch repairers.There was also a black- smiths shop. There were also two Carriers in the village which went to Newark on Wednesday and Lincoln on Friday,and the journey took an hour. There was a wind mill in the village which would grind all locally grown corn .There is no sign of it at all now.Just the name of a farm called Mill House Farm on the outskirts of the village.In the village today there are three shops.The post office which still sells sweets,but also sells toys cards,stationery and wool.The other two are general stores.They sell groceries,sweets,meat,home made cakes, vegetables,fruit and frozen goods.
